# Bayesian Inference

This presentation follows @Gelman2014 closely. Bayesian inference is about learning unobserved parameters $\theta$ or data $\tilde{y}$ though probability. These probability statements are conditional on the observed data $y$, that is $p(\theta|y)$ or $p(\tilde{y}|y)$.
